content:
DbProviderServices Class

In this Article

The factory for building command definitions; use the type of this object as the argument to the IServiceProvider.GetService method on the provider factory;

Syntax

Declaration

[System.CLSCompliant(false)]
public abstract class DbProviderServices

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • DbProviderServices

Inherited Members

,

,

Remarks

No content here will be updated; please do not add material here.

Constructors summary

DbProviderServices()

Initializes a new instance of the DbProviderServices class.

Methods summary

CreateCommandDefinition(DbCommandTree)

Creates command definition from command tree.
CreateCommandDefinition(DbCommand)

Creates a command definition that uses a specified command.
CreateCommandDefinition(DbProviderManifest,DbCommandTree)

Creates command definition from specified manifest andcommand tree.
CreateDatabase(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

Creates a database indicated by connection and creates schema objects.
CreateDatabaseScript(String,StoreItemCollection)

Generates a data definition langauge (DDL script that creates schema objects (tables, primary keys, foreign keys) based on the contents of the StoreItemCollection parameter and targeted for the version of the database corresponding to the provider manifest token.
CreateDbCommandDefinition(DbProviderManifest,DbCommandTree)

Creates a command definition object for the specified provider manifest and command tree.
DatabaseExists(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

Returns a value indicating whether a given database exists on the server and whether schema objects contained in the storeItemCollection have been created.
DbCreateDatabase(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

Creates a database indicated by connection and creates schema objects (tables, primary keys, foreign keys) based on the contents of a StoreItemCollection.
DbCreateDatabaseScript(String,StoreItemCollection)

Generates a data definition langauge (DDL script that creates schema objects (tables, primary keys, foreign keys) based on the contents of the StoreItemCollection parameter and targeted for the version of the database corresponding to the provider manifest token.
DbDatabaseExists(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

Returns a value indicating whether a given database exists on the server and whether schema objects contained in the storeItemCollection have been created.
DbDeleteDatabase(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

Deletes all store objects specified in the store item collection from the database and the database itself.
DbGetSpatialServices(String)

Gets the spatial services for the DbProviderServices.
DeleteDatabase(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

Deletes all store objects specified in the store item collection from the database and the database itself.
GetDbProviderManifest(String)

When overridden in a derived class, returns an instance of a class that derives from the DbProviderManifest.
GetDbProviderManifestToken(DbConnection)

Returns provider manifest token given a connection.
GetDbSpatialDataReader(DbDataReader,String)

Gets the spatial data reader for the DbProviderServices.
GetProviderFactory(DbConnection)

Retrieves the DbProviderFactory based on the specified DbConnection.
GetProviderManifest(String)

Returns the provider manifest by using the specified version information.
GetProviderManifestToken(DbConnection)

Returns provider manifest token.
GetProviderServices(DbConnection)

Returns providers given a connection.
GetSpatialDataReader(DbDataReader,String)

Gets the spatial data reader for the DbProviderServices.
GetSpatialServices(String)

Gets the spatial services for the DbProviderServices.
SetDbParameterValue(DbParameter,TypeUsage,Object)

Sets the parameter values for the DbProviderServices.

  • DbProviderServices()

    Initializes a new instance of the DbProviderServices class.

    protected DbProviderServices ();

Methods

  • CreateCommandDefinition(DbCommandTree)

    Creates command definition from command tree.

    public System.Data.Common.DbCommandDefinition CreateCommandDefinition (System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbCommandTree commandTree);

    Parameters

    • commandTree
      DbCommandTree

      The command tree.

    Returns

    • DbCommandDefinition

      The created command definition.

  • CreateCommandDefinition(DbCommand)

    Creates a command definition that uses a specified command.

    public virtual System.Data.Common.DbCommandDefinition CreateCommandDefinition (System.Data.Common.DbCommand prototype);

    Parameters

    • prototype
      DbCommand

      The command used to create command definition.

    Returns

    • DbCommandDefinition

      The created command definition that uses a specified command.

  • CreateCommandDefinition(DbProviderManifest,DbCommandTree)

    Creates command definition from specified manifest andcommand tree.

    public System.Data.Common.DbCommandDefinition CreateCommandDefinition (System.Data.Common.DbProviderManifest providerManifest, System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbCommandTree commandTree);

    Parameters

    • providerManifest
      DbProviderManifest

      The manifest.

    • commandTree
      DbCommandTree

      The command tree.

    Returns

    • DbCommandDefinition

      The created command definition.

  • CreateDatabase(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

    Creates a database indicated by connection and creates schema objects.

    public void CreateDatabase (System.Data.Common.DbConnection connection, Nullable<int> commandTimeout, System.Data.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection);

    Parameters

    • connection
      DbConnection

      Connection to a non-existent database that needs to be created and populated with the store objects indicated with the storeItemCollection parameter.

    • commandTimeout
      Nullable<Int32>

      Execution timeout for any commands needed to create the database.

    • storeItemCollection
      StoreItemCollection

      The collection of all store items based on which the script should be created.

  • CreateDatabaseScript(String,StoreItemCollection)

    Generates a data definition langauge (DDL script that creates schema objects (tables, primary keys, foreign keys) based on the contents of the StoreItemCollection parameter and targeted for the version of the database corresponding to the provider manifest token.

    public string CreateDatabaseScript (string providerManifestToken, System.Data.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection);

    Parameters

    • providerManifestToken
      String

      The provider manifest token identifying the target version.

    • storeItemCollection
      StoreItemCollection

      The structure of the database.

    Returns

    • String

      A DDL script that creates schema objects based on the contents of the StoreItemCollection parameter and targeted for the version of the database corresponding to the provider manifest token.

  • CreateDbCommandDefinition(DbProviderManifest,DbCommandTree)

    Creates a command definition object for the specified provider manifest and command tree.

    protected abstract System.Data.Common.DbCommandDefinition CreateDbCommandDefinition (System.Data.Common.DbProviderManifest providerManifest, System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbCommandTree commandTree);

    Parameters

    • providerManifest
      DbProviderManifest

      Provider manifest previously retrieved from the store provider.

    • commandTree
      DbCommandTree

      Command tree for the statement.

    Returns

    • DbCommandDefinition

      An executable command definition object.

  • DatabaseExists(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

    Returns a value indicating whether a given database exists on the server and whether schema objects contained in the storeItemCollection have been created.

    public bool DatabaseExists (System.Data.Common.DbConnection connection, Nullable<int> commandTimeout, System.Data.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection);

    Parameters

    • connection
      DbConnection

      Connection to a database whose existence is verified by this method.

    • commandTimeout
      Nullable<Int32>

      Execution timeout for any commands needed to determine the existence of the database.

    • storeItemCollection
      StoreItemCollection

      The collection of all store items contained in the database whose existence is determined by this method.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      True if the provider can deduce the database only based on the connection.

  • DbCreateDatabase(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

    Creates a database indicated by connection and creates schema objects (tables, primary keys, foreign keys) based on the contents of a StoreItemCollection.

    protected virtual void DbCreateDatabase (System.Data.Common.DbConnection connection, Nullable<int> commandTimeout, System.Data.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection);

    Parameters

    • connection
      DbConnection

      Connection to a non-existent database that needs to be created and populated with the store objects indicated with the storeItemCollection parameter.

    • commandTimeout
      Nullable<Int32>

      Execution timeout for any commands needed to create the database.

    • storeItemCollection
      StoreItemCollection

      The collection of all store items based on which the script should be created.

  • DbCreateDatabaseScript(String,StoreItemCollection)

    Generates a data definition langauge (DDL script that creates schema objects (tables, primary keys, foreign keys) based on the contents of the StoreItemCollection parameter and targeted for the version of the database corresponding to the provider manifest token.

    protected virtual string DbCreateDatabaseScript (string providerManifestToken, System.Data.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection);

    Parameters

    • providerManifestToken
      String

      The provider manifest token identifying the target version.

    • storeItemCollection
      StoreItemCollection

      The structure of the database.

    Returns

    • String

      A DDL script that creates schema objects based on the contents of the StoreItemCollection parameter and targeted for the version of the database corresponding to the provider manifest token.

  • DbDatabaseExists(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

    Returns a value indicating whether a given database exists on the server and whether schema objects contained in the storeItemCollection have been created.

    protected virtual bool DbDatabaseExists (System.Data.Common.DbConnection connection, Nullable<int> commandTimeout, System.Data.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection);

    Parameters

    • connection
      DbConnection

      Connection to a database whose existence is verified by this method.

    • commandTimeout
      Nullable<Int32>

      Execution timeout for any commands needed to determine the existence of the database.

    • storeItemCollection
      StoreItemCollection

      The structure of the database whose existence is determined by this method.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      True if the database indicated by the connection and the storeItemCollection parameter exists; otherwise, false.

  • DbDeleteDatabase(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

    Deletes all store objects specified in the store item collection from the database and the database itself.

    protected virtual void DbDeleteDatabase (System.Data.Common.DbConnection connection, Nullable<int> commandTimeout, System.Data.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection);

    Parameters

    • connection
      DbConnection

      Connection to an existing database that needs to be deleted.

    • commandTimeout
      Nullable<Int32>

      Execution timeout for any commands needed to delete the database.

    • storeItemCollection
      StoreItemCollection

      The structure of the database to be deleted.

  • DbGetSpatialServices(String)

    Gets the spatial services for the DbProviderServices.

    protected virtual System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialServices DbGetSpatialServices (string manifestToken);

    Parameters

    • manifestToken
      String

      The token information associated with the provider manifest.

    Returns

    • DbSpatialServices

      The spatial services.

  • DeleteDatabase(DbConnection,Nullable<Int32>,StoreItemCollection)

    Deletes all store objects specified in the store item collection from the database and the database itself.

    public void DeleteDatabase (System.Data.Common.DbConnection connection, Nullable<int> commandTimeout, System.Data.Metadata.Edm.StoreItemCollection storeItemCollection);

    Parameters

    • connection
      DbConnection

      Connection to an existing database that needs to be deleted.

    • commandTimeout
      Nullable<Int32>

      Execution timeout for any commands needed to delete the database.

    • storeItemCollection
      StoreItemCollection

      The structure of the database to be deleted.

  • GetDbProviderManifest(String)

    When overridden in a derived class, returns an instance of a class that derives from the DbProviderManifest.

    Parameters

    • manifestToken
      String

      The token information associated with the provider manifest.

    Returns

    • DbProviderManifest

      A DbProviderManifest object that represents the provider manifest.

  • GetDbProviderManifestToken(DbConnection)

    Returns provider manifest token given a connection.

    protected abstract string GetDbProviderManifestToken (System.Data.Common.DbConnection connection);

    Parameters

    • connection
      DbConnection

      Connection to provider.

    Returns

    • String

      The provider manifest token for the specified connection.

  • GetDbSpatialDataReader(DbDataReader,String)

    Gets the spatial data reader for the DbProviderServices.

    protected virtual System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialDataReader GetDbSpatialDataReader (System.Data.Common.DbDataReader fromReader, string manifestToken);

    Parameters

    • fromReader
      DbDataReader

      The reader where the spatial data came from.

    • manifestToken
      String

      The token information associated with the provider manifest.

    Returns

    • DbSpatialDataReader

      The spatial data reader.

  • GetProviderFactory(DbConnection)

    Retrieves the DbProviderFactory based on the specified DbConnection.

    public static System.Data.Common.DbProviderFactory GetProviderFactory (System.Data.Common.DbConnection connection);

    Parameters

    • connection
      DbConnection

      The connection to use.

    Returns

      The retrieved DbProviderFactory.

      String

    Parameters

      DbConnection

      Connection to provider.

      The DbProviderServices instanced based on the specified connection.

    Gets the spatial data reader for the DbProviderServices.

    Parameters

      DbDataReader

      The reader where the spatial data came from.

    Gets the spatial services for the DbProviderServices.

    Parameters

    • manifestToken
      String

      The token information associated with the provider manifest.

    Returns

    • DbSpatialServices

      The spatial services.

    Sets the parameter values for the DbProviderServices.

    protected virtual void SetDbParameterValue (System.Data.Common.DbParameter parameter, System.Data.Metadata.Edm.TypeUsage parameterType, object value);

    Parameters

    • parameter
